alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elmore and east central Owyhee Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Bruneau Canyon Viewpoint to near Glenns Ferry. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hammett around 350 PM MDT. Glenns Ferry around 400 PM MDT. Bruneau, Blair Trail Reservoir and Bruneau Sand Dunes around 410 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley
